content.1: Let every soul be subject unto the higher powers. For there is no power but of God: the powers that be are ordained of God.
content.2: Whosoever therefore resisteth the power, resisteth the ordinance of God: and they that resist shall receive to themselves damnation.
content.3: For rulers are not a terror to good works, but to the evil. Wilt thou then not be afraid of the power? do that which is good, and thou shalt have praise of the same:
content.4: For he is the minister of God to thee for good. But if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he beareth not the sword in vain: for he is the minister of God, a revenger to
content.6: For for this cause pay ye tribute also: for they are God’s ministers, attending continually upon this very thing.
content.7: Render therefore to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute
content.8: Owe no man any thing, but to love one another: for he that loveth another hath fulfilled the law.
content.9: For this, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not bear false witness, Thou shalt not covet; and if
content.10: Love worketh no ill to his neighbour: therefore love
content.11: And that, knowing the time, that now
content.12: The night is far spent, the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armour of light.
content.13: Let us walk honestly, as in the day; not in rioting and drunkenness, not in chambering and wantonness, not in strife and envying.
content.14: But put ye on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make not provision for the flesh, to
